intro: Tetracera madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tetracera, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
